column10: Speeding and failing to yield in a school zone when children are present.
Cars frequently speed at this stretch of road, despite two schools and a large park bordering the street.

Three middle school girls were walking home, just in front of me, after school ended. They were in the crosswalk and a woman driving a car eastbound was driving quickly and recklessly. She saw them midway through the street at the last moment and slammed on the brakes, narrowly missing the girls. The driver was clearly rattled at how close she was to striking them. Close calls involving children happen frequently at this crosswalk despite signage.
